verses.verse: "No<WH3808> one<WH6481> who is emasculated,<WH1795> <WH6481> or has his male<WH8212> organ<WH8212> cut<WH3772> off,<WH3772> shall enter<WH935> the assembly<WH6951> of the Lord.<WH3068>

"No<WH3808> one<WH4464> of illegitimate<WH4464> birth<WH4464> shall enter<WH935> the assembly<WH6951> of the Lord;<WH3068> none<WH3808> of his [descendants,] even<WH1571> to the tenth<WH6224> generation, shall enter<WH935> the assembly<WH6951> of the Lord.<WH3068>

"No<WH3808> Ammonite<WH5984> or Moabite<WH4125> shall enter<WH935> the assembly<WH6951> of the Lord;<WH3068> none<WH3808> of their [descendants,] even<WH1571> to the tenth<WH6224> generation, shall ever<WH5769> enter<WH935> the assembly<WH6951> of the Lord,<WH3068>

because<WH5921> <WH1697> <WH834> they did not meet<WH6923> you with food<WH3899> and water<WH4325> on the way<WH1870> when you came<WH3318> out of Egypt,<WH4714> and because<WH834> they hired<WH7936> against<WH5921> you Balaam<WH1109> the son<WH1121> of Beor<WH1160> from Pethor<WH6604> of Mesopotamia,<WH763> to curse<WH7043> you.

"Nevertheless, the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> was not willing<WH14> to listen<WH8085> to Balaam,<WH1109> but the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> turned<WH2015> the curse<WH7045> into a blessing<WH1293> for you because<WH3588> the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> loves<WH157> you.
"You shall never<WH3808> <WH5769> seek<WH1875> their peace<WH7965> or their prosperity<WH9186> all<WH3605> your days.<WH3117>
"You shall not detest<WH8581> an Edomite,<WH130> for he is your brother;<WH251> you shall not detest<WH8581> an Egyptian,<WH4713> because<WH3588> you were an alien<WH1616> in his land.<WH776>
"The sons<WH1121> of the third<WH7992> generation who<WH834> are born<WH3205> to them may enter<WH935> the assembly<WH6951> of the Lord.<WH3068>
"When<WH3588> you go<WH3318> out as an army<WH4264> against<WH5921> your enemies,<WH340> then you shall keep<WH8104> yourself from every<WH3605> evil<WH7451> thing.<WH1697>

"If<WH3588> there is among you any<WH376> man<WH376> who<WH834> is unclean<WH3808> <WH2889> because<WH4480> of a nocturnal<WH3915> emission,<WH7137> then he must go<WH3318> outside<WH413> <WH4480> <WH2351> the camp;<WH4264> he may not reenter<WH935> <WH8432> the camp.<WH4264>
"But it shall be when evening<WH6153> approaches,<WH6437> he shall bathe<WH7364> himself with water,<WH4325> and at sundown<WH8121> <WH935> he may reenter<WH935> <WH8432> the camp.<WH4264>
"You shall also have<WH1961> a place<WH3027> outside<WH4480> <WH2351> the camp<WH4264> and go<WH3318> out there,<WH8033>

and you shall have<WH1961> a spade<WH3489> among<WH5921> your tools,<WH240> and it shall be when you sit<WH3427> down<WH3427> outside,<WH2351> you shall dig<WH2658> with it and shall turn<WH7725> to cover<WH3680> up your excrement.<WH6627>

"Since<WH3588> the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> walks<WH1980> in the midst<WH7130> of your camp<WH4264> to deliver<WH5337> you and to defeat<WH5414> your enemies<WH340> before<WH6440> you, therefore your camp<WH4264> must be holy;<WH6918> and He must not see<WH7200> anything<WH1697> indecent<WH6172> among you lest He turn<WH7725> away<WH7725> from you.
"You shall not hand<WH5462> over<WH5462> to his master<WH113> a slave<WH5650> who<WH834> has escaped<WH5337> from his master<WH113> to you.

"He shall live<WH3427> with you in your midst,<WH7130> in the place<WH4725> which<WH834> he shall choose<WH977> in one<WH259> of your towns<WH8179> where it pleases<WH2896> him; you shall not mistreat<WH3238> him.

"None<WH3808> of the daughters<WH1323> of Israel<WH3478> shall be a cult<WH6945> prostitute,<WH6945> nor<WH3808> shall any<WH4480> of the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> be a cult<WH6945> prostitute.<WH6945>

"You shall not bring<WH935> the hire<WH868> of a harlot<WH2181> or the wages<WH4242> of a dog<WH3611> into the house<WH1004> of the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> for any<WH3605> votive<WH5088> offering,<WH5088> for both<WH1571> <WH8147> of these are an abomination<WH8441> to the Lord<WH3068> your God.<WH430>
"You shall not charge<WH9348> interest<WH9348> to your countrymen:<WH251> interest<WH5392> on money,<WH3701> food,<WH400> [or] anything<WH3605> that may be loaned<WH9348> at interest.<WH9348>

"You may charge<WH9348> interest<WH9348> to a foreigner,<WH5237> but to your countryman<WH251> you shall not charge<WH9348> interest,<WH9348> so<WH4616> that the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> may bless<WH1288> you in all<WH3605> that you undertake<WH3027> <WH9303> in the land<WH776> which<WH834> you are about to enter<WH935> to possess.<WH3423>

"When<WH3588> you make<WH5087> a vow<WH5088> to the Lord<WH3068> your God,<WH430> you shall not delay<WH309> to pay<WH9608> it, for it would be sin<WH2399> in you, and the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> will surely<WH1875> require<WH1875> it of you.
"However, if<WH3588> you refrain<WH2308> from vowing,<WH5087> it would not be sin<WH2399> in you.

"You shall be careful<WH8104> to perform<WH6213> what<WH4161> goes<WH4161> out from your lips,<WH8193> just<WH3152> as you have voluntarily<WH5071> vowed<WH5087> to the Lord<WH3068> your God,<WH430> what<WH834> you have promised.<WH1696>

"When<WH3588> you enter<WH935> your neighbor's vineyard,<WH3754> then you may eat<WH398> grapes<WH6025> until you are fully<WH7648> satisfied,<WH7648> but you shall not put<WH5414> any in your basket.<WH3627>

"When<WH3588> you enter<WH935> your neighbor's standing<WH7054> grain,<WH7054> then you may pluck<WH6998> the heads<WH4425> with your hand,<WH3027> but you shall not wield<WH5130> a sickle<WH2770> in your neighbor's standing<WH7054> grain.<WH7054>
